channel.title: Run Server
channel.description: When i run my server i get "The system can not find the path specified" Any ideas of what to do?

item.title: Run Server
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

For your run.bat it will be

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe" server

You have to change “server” to your main class.

For compile.bat it will be

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java

And of course, you will need JDK 6u16 for those to work, I use C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe when I compile, because I have 6u2 instead of 6u16

I suppose something like this will work

@echo off @TITLE Running Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe" server pause
and for compiling

@echo off @TITLE Compiling Java Files "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run Server
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Pretty sure I helped with this earlier.

Update your JDK to JDK 6 Update 16. Install it where Telenim stated.

Make sure your runserver and client are checking for JDK 6 U16.

Read full topic

item.title: Run Server
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

C:\Program Files\Java

is where your JDK and JRE versions are installed

Read full topic

item.title: Run Server
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

Right click on Run.bat or your Server runner, and click edit. It should open with notepad. Look for the part where it says “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe” *.java or something close to that. Change that path to your version of JDK.

Read full topic
